entry.title: How to get and farm the Vestigial Organ in The First Descendant
entry.summary:
The Vesgitial Organ is a rocket launcher in The First Descendant that has matched the likes of other popular weapons like the Tamer. It’ll work exceptionally well for bossing and mobbing, though you will go through its ammo rather quickly.
How to get the Vestigial Organ in The First Descendant
To get the Vestigial Organ in The First Descendant, you have to play the Miragestone: Vulgus Strategic Outpost Zone Recon Mission in the Agna Desert region. It has a 50% chance to be given to you upon completing the mission.
This mission isn’t always readily available, so make sure the mission timer hasn’t started yet. Be there within five minutes before the event starts.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Best Vesgitial Organ farm
The best way to farm the Vestigial Organ is to repeat this mission or, after completing it, kill mobs of enemies in hopes that it’ll drop. Luckily, you can visit this mission once you get to Hard mode and it’ll be a higher level than 50.
You can hold onto the weapon until you can start getting level 100 gear. It’ll be easier that way so you can use Weapon Level Transmission to not have to farm for a new one. Though, with steep resource costs, it’s better to just farm a fresh one once you’re at that level.
Screenshot by Destructoid
Best rolls for the Vesgitial Organ in The First Descendant
The following are the best rolls to have for your Vestigial Organ. You can either find one with these rolls or use the Weapon Readjustment feature at the Workbench.
Explosive ATK
Elemental ATK
Weapon Change Speed
Attribute Status Effect Trigger Rate
The Vestigial Organ does not have a good critical hit rate or damage, so it’s pointless to roll for that or apply mods that increase it. With raw damage and increased elemental stats, this launcher will then be good to be an all-rounder weapon.

entry.title: GreedFall 2 will enter Early Access on Steam in September
entry.summary:
GreedFall 2, the upcoming RPG title from developer Spiders, is set to enter Early Access period on Steam on September 24, 2024. Spiders and publisher Nacon revealed a new release date announcement trailer, featuring the Early Access release date amid cinematic glimpses.
The developers are planning to reveal more information in August via a new gameplay video, which will show more about what players can expect from GreedFall 2 early access. The early access roadmap was already shown by the developers in March 2024, which gives fans a rough idea about what GreedFall 2 will offer at the start.
Players will get to experience the first chapters of the main quest in GreedFall 2 during the Steam early access on PC. Moreover, players will get to explore locations such as Teer Fradee, Thynia and Uxantis. There will also be some companions available during the early access period. As for future updates during early access, Spider plans on adding new regions, companions, local and main quests, skills, customization, and more.
Speaking about GreedFall 2 overall, the developers have said that the sequel will be “completely new and bigger” with more regions, enemies, quests, characters, skills and more. The developers have said that they decided to opt for early access so that they can receive feedback from fans and provide a more polished game with improvements to combat and exploration. The first game received a fairly mixed reception at launch, so the decision to open up the game for feedback right from the start can be a welcoming start for GreedFall 2's journey.
GreedFall 2 is coming to PC via Steam first, but it will eventually also be released on the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S.

entry.title: Riot reportedly scraps Smash Bros-style prototype set in League of Legends’ universe
entry.summary:
Riot Games has apparently cancelled an in-development platform fighter called Pool Party. A report from Mikhail Klimentov (ReaderGrev) claims that Pool Party would have had gameplay similar to Nintendo's Smash Bros., set in the League of Legends universe.
There were around 70-80 developers working on the game before Riot Games sunsetted its development. It's also suggested that Riot Games was working on a platform fighter because they saw potential in building an esports landscape around it.
Joe Hixson, senior communications director at Riot Games, responded in a statement to Klimentov, saying that Riot Games always has a number of projects in “various phases of R&D, and spinning projects up and down happens multiple times a year.”
The report also alleges Riot executives were “spooked” after the perceived failure of Multiversus, a crossover IP platform-fighting game from Warner Bros. Though Pool Party was originally envisioned as a "hardcore fighting game," it went through several revisions, including the addition of party game elements and gameplay mechanics which are “casual-friendly”. It has also been claimed that the fundamental changes to the scope and vision of Pool Party left some of the staff frustrated.
The report has also claims that Riot Games offered half of the team working on Pool Party to be reassigned to a different project within the studio, and other developers were looking for new positions within the company. According to Klimentov's source, 10 have still not received an offer nor were part of the internal application process, which could imply they've left the company.
None of this has affected 2XKO however, Riot's publicly announced fighting game. The company is preparing to debut a new demo at Evo 2024, and plans are in motion for a 2025 launch.

Which weapons have Akimbo Kills in Modern Warfare 3?
Akimbo weapons allow Operators to wield two weapons in their hands without using ADS. To get Akimbo Kills in Modern Warfare 3, you must customize your weapon in the Gunsmith with the build. Here's a complete list of guns that can be used for this task:

You may have noticed that the Akimbo Kills weapons are mostly tied to the Handguns collection. Equip the suitable materials by going to the Rear Grip section in the Gunsmith, showcasing an option for the Akimbo.
The WSP Swarm SMG is the only weapon not a part of the Handguns class. For this, go to the Conversion Kit instead and place the WSP Akimbo Brace Stock. Other weapons, such as the Akimbo Shotgun, could work but may not register for the Akimbo Kills objective.

If you are trying to complete a Weekly Challenge in Modern Warfare 3, you'll likely need to use a Recommended Akimbo-based weapon. These guns will be marked with a fire symbol in the collection. This requirement will sometimes limit your choices, depending on the current season's Recommended guns.
The Akimbo builds will also be locked behind a particular task. For example, the Akimbo FTAC Siege will only be available after you complete two Daily Challenges. Due to the gun's limited range, it's best to use it in small-sized maps like Shipment, Emergency, and Stash House. You can also utilize it in Zombies mode for an extra challenge.

entry.summary:
For quite some time now, I've seen the concept of hotels pop up in Sims 4 forums, where fans have expressed their desire for it in a new pack. Although it may have seen out-of-reach after all these years, the Lovestruck Gameplay trailer has finally introduced this feature to change up your Woohoo game.
Toward the end of the trailer, you'll notice a hotel Sims can use for sleep or after a romantic night out. This will be a part of Lovestruck's newest Woohoo spots, including a place to get your freak on in a closet.
Once the expansion drops, players can rent a room at the hotel, also known as "Beso Rápido," in the new world. However, it may be linked to a rabbithole event, a mechanic where the in-game camera doesn't follow Sims. The hotel itself may not be customizable, but at least the feature has finally been put in Sims 4. It also seems much more accessible than getting a vacation rental since you can come and go as you please.
The arrival of hotels could lead to a game pack that further explores this building type. I've always dreamed about running a bed-and-breakfast, or maybe even a Suite Life of Zack and Cody-inspired hotel in the Sims world. Maxis Studios already has the basis to make this work, considering that you can be a landlord in the For Rent expansion pack. All it needs now is a hotel system, setting up a few rooms for Sims to stay in temporarily. Additionally, the studio could utilize the employee customization from the Get to Work EP for receptionists, housekeeping, and management.
While a complete overhaul of hotel features may not be on the horizon just yet, we can wait and see what the Lovestruck EP has in store. The Gameplay trailer did reveal plenty of other content to look forward to, from Cupid's Corner dating app to attraction preferences. entry.title: How to slide across a vehicle in Fortnite Chapter 5 Season 3
entry.summary:
As you complete weekly quests in Fortnite, you'll find a mix of season-specific challenges and general tasks such as traveling in cars, dealing damage with particular weapons, or collecting ammo. A surprisingly difficult task you'll find is sliding across a vehicle, which, although sounds easy, is much harder to pull off successfully than you'd initially expect.
How to slide across a vehicle in Fortnite
Sliding across a vehicle requires precise movements involving sprinting toward a car, jumping, and sliding across its surface. The easiest way to do this is to find a Whiplash sports car during your match, stand behind it, and get a running start before jumping onto the vehicle. From here, hold CTRL on PC or the right analog stick as you land on the car to slide forward.
It's easier to start from the back and jump forward. Screenshot by Destructoid
Since this is a very specific movement, you may have to repeat it a few times to get the timing right. Your goal is to jump in a way that you land on the back of the car so that, once you slide forward, you'll go right along the entire surface. Landing closer to the front won't count toward the weekly quest, even if you pull off the slide successfully.
Another challenge is ensuring no other players are nearby as you're doing this. A good rule of thumb is to avoid popular landmarks or bosses as you attempt this quest, as other people usually crowd around these spots. Unnamed locations or small gas stations are the way to go, as these often spawn a car or two and have few people visiting them until later in the match. If you do see anyone, quickly pick up a weapon and eliminate them from the match before attempting the slide again.

entry.title: How to change display name and tagline in Valorant
entry.summary:
Players in Valorant all have a display name, known as your Riot ID, that teammates as well as opponents can see. Then, there is also the Riot username that is used to log in to your Valorant account to play the game. While it is possible to change your Riot ID, and the display name, it is not possible to change your username.
The Riot ID, or display name, consists of a chosen name that other players can also see, and it is suffixed by a tagline. This tagline is attached to a display name to create an overall unique display name.
The display name can be anything you like, regardless of whether it is already taken or not, and that is why the tagline exists, so as to ensure that the account can be uniquely identified. You can also change your tagline, but it needs to be unique.
How to change your display name in Valorant
Go to the Riot Account login page.
Log in to your Riot account.
Head to the Riot ID tab.
Under ‘Game Name’ section, enter your desired Valorant display name.
You can also enter your desired tagline in the next field.
Click ‘Save Changes’ to confirm your new display name.
Gamers who play multiple Riot Games titles can choose different display names for all their games. This means that changes made to your Valorant display name, will not alter your display name in League of Legends, or any other Riot game.
It is only possible to change your Riot ID once every 30 days, so give it a good thought before finalizing the change. Also, make sure that the display name does not contain offensive language, as it can lead to a suspension or permanent ban on your account.

entry.title: Best Thunder Cage build in The First Descendant
entry.summary:
While it's not worth doing for random weapons in The First Descendant, creating builds for some of your best weapons can elevate them from great to excellent. Most Modules are only stat boosts, but those stat boosts can make or break these weapons. One such weapon you get early is quite powerful on its own, but only gets much better with the right Modules. Here's the best build for the Thunder Cage SMG in The First Descendant.
The best Modules for the Thunder Cage SMG in The First Descendant
Image via Destructoid.
The Thunder Cage's greatest strengths are in both its rate of fire and attack speed, dishing out endless bullets quickly. However, that means you're constantly contending with reloads and the weapon not always being up to snuff in raw DPS. Rather than upping the damage however, we want to ensure that those clips go out quickly while reloads are far easier to deal with. The following nine Modules should do just that:
Reload Insight
Recycling Genius
Expand Weapon Charge
Fire Rate UP
Maximize Weight Balance
Vibration Absorption
Hawk-Eye
Weak Point Insight
Better Insight
The first five mods are designed with the core purpose in mind. We're adding in fire rate, rounds per magazine, and reload speed so you're dumping a clip into whatever enemy you see. The other four mods lift the weapon in other ways, with Vibration Absorption and Hawk-Eye providing some utility through recoil and accuracy. Weak Point Insight and Better Insight giving weak point damage and critical hit chance respectively.
Who is the best Descendant to pair the Thunder Cage with?
With the right build, Bunny is the best character by far to run the Thunder Cage with. If you're building out Bunny properly, you're adding in electricity damage somewhere since all of her builds are electricity-based. This can help the Thunder Cage's unique passive of making enemies explode into electric bursts. It's a match made in heaven.

Xbox Game Pass Core, which offers online access and a much smaller library of curated games, is changing its yearly from $60 to $75. The $10 monthly price for that tier, however, will remain unchanged. PC Game Pass is increasing from $10 per month to $12, but that tier will still include Day One releases. entry.title: Zenless Zone Zero review: painfully cool animation can't save a superficial gacha

They were talking about the nebulous collection of sensations a player is exposed to when heads explode, coins jangle, and balls bounce. Zenless Zone Zero is a game deeply informed by the philosophy of juice. Like the lootbox hawkers of yesteryear, gacha designers understand the appeal and power of a pleasingly animated gizmo, ker-chunking open and fizzing with potential. This poppy visual and sonic language stretches across Hoyo's latest game, from its cinematic moments, to each character's attacks, to the cute bunny mascots that erupt into gatling guns, to the barista's coffee-making ritual and the recipes of the robo-limbed noodle server. entry.title: Disco Elysium-inspired RPG Hollow Home is a memory of Mariupol from before Russia's invasion
entry.summary: The Ukrainian city of Mariupol came under heavy bombardment during the opening months of Russia's invasion in 2022, a programme of artillery and air strikes that damaged or destroyed the majority of residential buildings and has killed or dispossessed thousands of people. It has now been occupied by Russia for almost two years, during which, as reported by the Associated Press, Russia has demolished, rebuilt and renamed much of the city, overwriting its Ukrainian heritage. The Disco Elysium-inspired RPG Hollow Home is a memory of Mariupol from just before the war - not a 1:1 recreation, but a collection of details, colours, personalities and some familiar buildings, painstakingly amassed and offered up in the face of erasure. Speaking to me during a very brief demo at Digital Dragons in Poland this year, artist Anastasia Hlyniana called my attention to the plants jutting from old car tyres around the game's isometric map, which she says are a common sight in Mariupol. It launches in Japan on iOS and Android devices this September, and is expected to be released in other regions of the world at a later date. According to the game's website, Disney Pixel RPG will feature a story about merging worlds, fast-paced strategic battles (with simple controls for mobile and even an auto-play function), customization for your own avatar character, and expeditions that allow you to send pixelated Disney characters out on missions to gather materials and more. Players in Japan can pre-register for Disney Pixel RPG right now ahead of the game's September 9 launch – there's no word on if other regions will be able to pre-register anytime soon, however. "The game world that these Disney characters call home have suddenly been invaded by strange programs, and are starting to break down," the story description reads on the game's website. "These previously isolated game worlds have merged, throwing all the characters into confusion. Take on the role of a player of these games and join Disney characters as you embark on an epic quest across multiple game worlds to restore order." The game's listing on Apple's App Store notes it will be free-to-play but will feature microtransactions. entry.title: A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead Story Trailer Showcases The Silent End Of The World
entry.summary:
Developer Stormind Games and publisher Saber Interactive have released a new story trailer for A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead showcasing more of this upcoming first-person horror game's silent alien-infested world. And it continues to look like a scary new addition to the A Quiet Place movie universe. Though there's still no release date – it's launching sometime this year on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC – this story trailer reveals more about the state of the world in The Road Ahead. It seemingly begins on Day One, when the aliens, which possess incredible hearing that requires people to remain silent to survive, attack Earth. It then jumps ahead to Day 105, with Alex, an asthmatic college student trying to survive the end of the world with her boyfriend Martin, on the hunt for supplies and more. Check it out for yourself in the story trailer for A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead below:
As you can see, it seems Alex might be pregnant, which, if you've seen the first A Quiet Place movie, can make trying to remain silent in this world quite difficult. We'll have to wait a little longer to find out how the story of A Quiet Place: The Road Ahead plays out because it launches later this year on PS5, Xbox Series X/S, and PC. entry.title: Transformers: Galactic Trials Mixes Racing With Roguelite Combat This October

Hasbro and developer Outright Games have revealed Transformers: Galactic Trials, an arcade robot racing game with roguelite combat. It launches on October 11 on PlayStation, Xbox, Switch, and PC. You can play solo or against a friend. Check it out for yourself in the Transformers: Galactic Trials trailer below:
"Evil Nemesis Prime has stolen the Prime Relics, which bestow incredible powers on whoever possesses them," the game's description reads. "Now, the Autobots and Decepticons are in an explosive race to recover the relics – the future of Cybertron is in your hands. "Choose your character from icons like Bumblebee, Megatron, and Optimus Prime. Speed into action on battle-race circuits, drift and boost to charge up Energon, then unleash devastating special moves in battle. And use your experience to unlock new skills, characters, and skins. It's the ultimate test of your favorite Transformers' abilities, which will decide the future of Cybertron." Transformers: Galactic Trials hits PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC on October 11, 2024. Are you going to check out Transformers: Galactic Trials this October? entry.title: I turned my PC off during the "don't switch off" symbol in five different games to see what would happen and boy was this an annoying experiment

"Don't turn off your system when this symbol is displayed," goes the message seen often while booting up a game (or some other version of these words). The implication is clear. We last saw Flintlock during the Xbox Games Showcase a few weeks ago, but you can check out 20 minutes of new gameplay footage in the video below. Set during a later stage of the game, a synopsis adds context to the footage: "Join Nor and Enki as they prepare to step into the deserts of Wanderer’s Rest to take on the personal guard of the god Dukmar. With an entire army hunting for her, Nor will need all of her skills to make it to her eventual destination - the City of Sibyl, where she hopes the gods’ true intentions will finally be revealed."

entry.title: Don't Nod Delays Lost Records: Bloom & Rage To Give The Next Life Is Strange Some Space
entry.summary: Developer Don't Nod Entertainment has delayed its upcoming two-part narrative-driven adventure game, Lost Records: Bloom & Rage, to early 2025. As for why, the team wants to give its spiritual cousin, Life Is Strange: Double Exposure, some space to shine later this year. Lost Records was originally due out in late 2024, which is also when the next Life is Strange is set to launch. Instead of competing with Life Is Strange, a series that Don't Nod created with the first Life Is Strange and continued with Life Is Strange 2 before Double Exposure developer Deck Nine took over with 2017's Before the Storm and 2021's True Colors, the studio decided to push to 2025. We've made the decision to move the release dates of Lost Records: Bloom & Rage to early 2025. We know you're all excited for both Lost Records and the new Life is Strange game, and we wanted to ensure both have adequate space to shine. entry.title: Frostpunk 2 Delayed To September
entry.summary: Frostpunk 2 has been delayed. Originally slated to launch next month on July 25, the upcoming narrative-driven city-builder is now arriving on September 20. Developer 11 Bit Studios sates that following a recent beta, the team wants to take extra time addressing feedback to ensure the best possible experience. In a press release, design director Jakub Stokalski and art director Lukasz Juszczyk issued the following statement: “Based on the surveys we received after playing Beta, the average rating you gave us was 8 out of 10. We’re super grateful for that! At the same time, it was only a small slice of a work-in-progress, still-growing game. While our backlog is plentiful, it was an opportunity for us to listen to what you enjoyed, and what didn’t quite land yet”. “This allowed us to prioritise things better, and bring upfront the features and modifications we were already working on. But we also realised that to guarantee the best possible experience on launch, we need more time to finish the development of Frostpunk 2. That’s why we made the difficult decision to postpone its release to September 20th, 2024”. 11 Bit States that it plans to work on new additions to existing game mechanics and improve the UI and UX, among other things. Frostpunk 2 will launch first for PC on September 20. PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S versions are planned to arrive later. Now, just a few days later, developer From Software has released a new patch for the game that should make Shadow of the Erdtree a bit easier. Now live, Calibration Update 1.12.2 targets the scaling of the attack and damage negation given to players with each Shadow Realm Blessing upgrade. Here's what's changed: The attack and damage negation has been increased for the first half of the maximum amount of Blessing enhancements, and the second half will now be more gradual. The attack and damage negation granted by the final level of Blessing enhancements has been slightly increased.
This patch should apply automatically like any other Elden Ring update but if it doesn't – the Calibration Version listed at the bottom right reads "1.12.2" if it has – select "LOGIN" and that will apply the latest version of the game. The only other thing this update contains is word from From Software on a confirmed bug where the raytracing settings of Shadow of the Erdtree are automatically enabled (if you've previously loaded save data from previous game versions), which is causing framerate issues for some players. If you're encountering said issues, check to see if you have raytracing on or off in the game's system graphical settings. This patch arrives after one that hit the game last week, which added new hairtsyles, inventory features, balance adjustments, and more to Elden Ring ahead of Shadow of the Erdtree's launch. entry.title: It’s a Bar... In Space!
entry.summary: In a universe where bagels meet bars, the BAGEL engine has been perfectly toasted, and the ScummVM team is now ready to serve a slice of The Space Bar nostalgia. No, it’s not the key on your keyboard. Rather, it’s a detective story set on a distant planet. Important data has been stolen, and the perpetrator is a shape-shifter laying low in a spaceport dive bar until he can flee off-planet. You play a hard-boiled detective who has the skill to psychically visit bar patrons’ memories to gather clues and narrow down suspects. This is thanks to the kind people at ZOOM Platform, who provided us with the original game sources to work with. Help us test the game by grabbing a daily build. Read through our testing guidelines. The game features a lot of options to chat around with bar patrons’ and do various actions in the different flashbacks. So we really need people to spend time experimenting and make sure everything works correctly. And please take some screenshots along the way. If you don’t own The Space Bar, you can try one of the free demos or purchase it digitally from the ZOOM Platform. Testing is also available on Steam via a beta branch, check the Steam announcement for more details. Now, good luck, and fingers crossed you can find the perp. Otherwise, your bureau chief will have you getting up close and personal with toilet duties for the rest of your career. Oh, and PS: The viewpoints of different aliens differ. For the Bartender, who has segmented eyes, even the original developers felt it was difficult and left in a cheat key of ScrollLock to switch back to a single viewpoint. Feel free to use it if, at any point, the flashback becomes too much for you :) >
